DOC.brief_title: Test Chamber Pressure Divers Chamber Attendants
DOC.detailed_description: In clinical trial evaluate hyperbaric oxygen , blind challenge . Options participant blind include offer regular air lower pressure hyperbaric oxygen intervention , compress participant pressure provide different gas mix active sham arm . In trial hyperbaric oxygen brain injury , investigator offer sham chamber session ( regular air 1.2 atmosphere absolute [ atm ab ] ) compare active intervention , hyperbaric oxygen ( 100 % oxygen 1.5 atm ab ) . It unknown whether individual familiar pressure change , diver hyperbaric chamber inside attendant , could discern difference pressure thereby become unblinded study allocation . In study , 80 experience diver chamber inside attendant enrol randomly assign one four possible chamber pressure one two breathing gas . After brief hyperbaric chamber excursion , ask chamber pressure compress gas breathe . If participant accurately report chamber pressure breathe gas , pressure-familiar individual exclude blinded clinical trial hyperbaric oxygen .
DOC.criteria: Adult , age 18 65 year Completion medical history questionnaire without concern identify exposure increase pressure Familiarity atmospheric pressure change : Experienced active hyperbaric chamber inside attendant : 50 hyperbaric compression , 4 last 4 month ; Experienced active SCUBA diver : 20 lifetime compress gas open water ( swim pool ) dive , 10 last 12 month Able equalize middle ear pressure easily Pregnancy Known risk barotrauma , identify medical history questionnaire , : Recent ( within 12 month ) inner ear sinus surgery Spontaneous pneumothorax Pulmonary cyst Emphysema Bullous lung disease Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease need chronic active therapy Inability tolerate chamber confinement pressure Presence heart failure Presence implant electrical device , except hyperbaricapproved pacemaker Presence middleear tympanostomy tube
